    <us-gaap:InventoryWriteDown contextRef="From2020-08-01to2021-07-31" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">150000</us-gaap:InventoryWriteDown>
    <us-gaap:InventoryWriteDown contextRef="From2019-08-01to2020-07-31" unitRef="USD" xsi:nil="true" />
    <us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-08-01to2021-07-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;1. Organization and Business&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;All references to &amp;#8220;PURE,&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;we&amp;#8221;,&#13;&amp;#8220;our,&amp;#8221; and &amp;#8220;us&amp;#8221; refer to PURE Bioscience, Inc. and our wholly owned subsidiary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;PURE Bioscience, Inc. is focused on developing and&#13;commercializing our proprietary antimicrobial products that provide solutions to the health and environmental challenges of pathogen and&#13;hygienic control. Our technology platform is based on patented stabilized ionic silver, and our initial products contain silver dihydrogen&#13;citrate, or SDC. SDC is a broad-spectrum, non-toxic antimicrobial agent that is manufactured as a liquid delivered in various concentrations.&#13;We currently distribute and contract the manufacture and distribution of our SDC-based disinfecting and sanitizing products. We also contract&#13;manufacture and sell SDC-based formulations to manufacturers for use as a raw material ingredient in the production of personal care products.&#13;We believe our technology platform has potential application in a number of industries. We intend to focus our current resources on providing&#13;food safety solutions to the food industry.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We were incorporated in the state of California in&#13;August 1992 as Innovative Medical Services. In September 2003, we changed our name to PURE Bioscience. In March 2011, we reincorporated&#13;in the state of Delaware. We operate in one business segment.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Liquidity and Going Concern&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We have a history of recurring losses, and as of July&#13;31, 2021 we have incurred a cumulative net loss of $125,800,000. During the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, we recorded a net loss of&#13;$2,319,000 on recorded net revenue of $3,927,000. In addition, during the year ended July 31, 2021 we used $1,688,000 in operating and&#13;investing activities resulting in a cash balance of $2,390,000 as of July 31, 2021. Our history of recurring operating losses, and negative&#13;cash flows from operating activities give rise to substantial doubt regarding our ability to continue as a going concern. The financial&#13;statements do not include any adjustments to reflect the possible future effects on the recoverability and classification of assets or&#13;the amounts and classifications of liabilities that may result from our possible inability to continue as a going concern.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Our future capital requirements depend on numerous&#13;forward-looking factors. These factors may include, but are not limited to, the following: the acceptance of, and demand for, our products;&#13;our success and the success of our partners in selling our products; our success and the success of our partners in obtaining regulatory&#13;approvals to sell our products; the costs of further developing our existing products and technologies; the extent to which we invest&#13;in new product and technology development; and the costs associated with the continued operation, and any future growth, of our business.&#13;The outcome of these and other forward-looking factors will substantially affect our liquidity and capital resources.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Until we can continually generate positive cash flow from operations, we&#13;will need to continue to fund our operations with the proceeds of offerings of our equity and debt securities. However, we cannot ensure&#13;that additional financing will be available when needed or that, if available, financing will be obtained on terms favorable to us or&#13;to our stockholders. If we raise additional funds from the issuance of equity securities, substantial dilution to our existing stockholders&#13;would likely result. If we raise additional funds by incurring debt financing, the terms of the debt may involve significant cash payment&#13;obligations as well as covenants and specific financial ratios that may restrict our ability to operate our business.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2020-08-01to2021-07-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basis of Presentation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying consolidated financial statements&#13;include the consolidated accounts of PURE Bioscience, Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiary, ETIH2O Inc., a Nevada corporation. ETIH2O&#13;Inc. has no business and no material assets or liabilities and there have been no significant transactions related to ETIH2O Inc. during&#13;the periods presented in the consolidated financial statements. All inter-company balances and transactions have been eliminated.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Effective August 1, 2018, we adopted the Financial&#13;Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;) Accounting Standards Codification (&amp;#8220;ASC&amp;#8221;), Topic 606, Revenue from Contracts&#13;with Customers (&amp;#8220;Topic 606&amp;#8221;). Under Topic 606, revenue is recognized at an amount that reflects the consideration to which&#13;we expect to be entitled in exchange for transferring goods or services to a customer. This principle is applied using the following 5-step&#13;process:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;1.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Identify the contract with the customer&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;2.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Identify the performance obligations in the contract&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;3.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Determine the transaction price&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;4.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;5.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Recognize revenue when (or as) each performance obligation is satisfied&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Under Topic 606, we recognize revenue when we satisfy&#13;a performance obligation by transferring control of the promised goods or services to our customers, in an amount that reflects the consideration&#13;we expect to be entitled to in exchange for those goods or services.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Our technology platform is based on patented stabilized&#13;ionic silver, and our initial products contain silver dihydrogen citrate, or SDC. SDC is a broad-spectrum, non-toxic antimicrobial agent,&#13;which offers 24-hour residual protection and formulates well with other compounds. We sell various configurations and dilutions of SDC&#13;direct to customers and through distributors. We currently offer PURE&lt;sup&gt;&amp;#174;&lt;/sup&gt; Hard Surface as a food contact surface sanitizer&#13;and disinfectant to restaurant chains, food processors and food transportation companies. We also offer PURE Control&lt;sup&gt;&amp;#174;&lt;/sup&gt;&#13;as a direct food contact processing aid.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Contract terms for unit price, quantity, shipping&#13;and payment are governed by sales agreements and purchase orders which we consider to be a customer&amp;#8217;s contract in all cases. The&#13;unit price is considered the observable stand-alone selling price for the arrangements. Any promotional or sales discounts are applied&#13;evenly to the units sold for purposes of calculating standalone selling price.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Product sales generally consist of a single performance&#13;obligation that we satisfy at a point in time. We recognize product revenue when the following events have occurred: (a) we have transferred&#13;physical possession of the products, (b) we have a present right to payment, (c) the customer has legal title to the products, and (d)&#13;the customer bears significant risks and rewards of ownership of the products.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Our direct customer and distributor sales are invoiced&#13;based on received purchase orders. Our payment terms on invoiced direct customer and distributor sales range between 30 and 90 days after&#13;we satisfy our performance obligation. The majority of our customers are on 30 day payment terms. We currently offer no right of return&#13;on invoiced sales and maintain no allowance for sales returns.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Shipping and handling are treated as activities to&#13;fulfill promises to customers and any amounts billed to a customer, if applicable, represent revenues earned for the goods provided. Costs&#13;related to such shipping and handling billings are classified as cost of sales.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We do not have significant categories of revenue that&#13;may impact how the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty of revenue and cash flows are affected by economic factors.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;A summary of our revenue by product type for the fiscal years ended July&#13;31, 2021 and 2020 is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="6" style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;July 31,&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2021&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2020&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 72%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;PURE Hard Surface&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 11%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;3,563,947&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 11%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;6,706,344&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;SILV&amp;#201;RION&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;134,053&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;210,656&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;3,698,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;6,917,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Variable Consideration&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We record revenue from customers in an amount that&#13;reflects the transaction price we expect to be entitled to after transferring control of those goods or services. From time to time, we&#13;offer sales promotions on our products such as discounts. Variable consideration is estimated at contract inception only to the extent&#13;that it is probable that a significant reversal of revenue will not occur.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The preparation of consolidated financial statements&#13;in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America, or GAAP, requires management to make estimates&#13;and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in the consolidated financial statements, and the disclosures made in the accompanying&#13;notes to the consolidated financial statements. Actual results could differ materially from those estimates. Those estimates and assumptions&#13;include estimates for reserves of uncollectible accounts, inventory obsolescence, depreciable lives of property and equipment, analysis&#13;of impairments of recorded long-term tangible and intangible assets, realization of deferred tax assets, accruals for potential liabilities&#13;and assumptions made in valuing stock instruments issued for services.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Cash and cash equivalents consist of cash and highly&#13;liquid investments with original maturities from the purchase date of three months or less.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Restricted Cash&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company is required to maintain $75,000 in a restricted&#13;certificate of deposit account in order to fully collateralize four revolving credit card accounts.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Accounts Receivable&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Trade accounts receivable are recorded net of allowances&#13;for doubtful accounts. We evaluate the collectability of our trade accounts receivable based on a number of factors. In circumstances&#13;where we becomes aware of a specific customer&amp;#8217;s inability to meet its financial obligations to the Company, a specific reserve for&#13;bad debts is estimated and recorded, which reduces the recognized receivable to the estimated amount the Company believes will ultimately&#13;be collected. In addition to specific customer identification of potential bad debts, bad debt charges are recorded based on our historical&#13;losses and an overall assessment of past due trade accounts receivable outstanding. The allowance for doubtful accounts was zero at July&#13;31, 2021 and 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Inventories&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or net&#13;realizable value, and net of a valuation allowance for potential excess or obsolete material. Cost is determined using the average cost&#13;method. We regularly review our inventory quantities on hand and record a provision for excess and obsolete inventory based primarily&#13;on our estimated forecast of product demand and our ability to sell the product(s) concerned. Demand for our products can fluctuate significantly.&#13;Factors that could affect demand for our products include unanticipated changes in consumer preferences, general market conditions or&#13;other factors, which may result in cancellations of advance orders or a reduction in the rate of reorders placed by customers. Additionally,&#13;our management&amp;#8217;s estimates of future product demand may be inaccurate, which could result in an understated or overstated provision&#13;required for excess and obsolete inventory. At July 31, 2021, the Company determined that a reserve for inventory obsolescence of $150,000&#13;was required. At July 31, 2020, management determined that a reserve for inventory obsolescence was not required.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Property, Plant and Equipment&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Property, plant and equipment is stated at cost less&#13;accumulated depreciation. Depreciation is computed using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the assets. The estimated&#13;useful lives of our property, plant, and equipment range from three to ten years. Capitalized costs associated with leasehold improvements&#13;are depreciated over the lesser of the useful life of the asset or the remaining life of the lease. Depreciation is generally included&#13;in selling, general and administrative expense. Depreciation related to manufacturing is systematically allocated to inventory produced,&#13;and expensed through cost of goods sold at the time inventory is sold.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Management assesses the carrying value of property&#13;and equipment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying value may not be recoverable. If there is indication&#13;of impairment, management prepares an estimate of future cash flows expected to result from the use of the asset and its eventual disposition.&#13;If these cash flows are less than the carrying amount of the asset, an impairment loss is recognized to write down the asset to its estimated&#13;fair value. For the years ended July 31, 2021 and 2020, Company Management determined there were no indicators of impairment of its property&#13;and equipment.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Patents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We have filed a number of patent applications with&#13;the United States Patent and Trademark Office and in foreign countries. Certain legal and related costs incurred in connection with pending&#13;patent applications have been capitalized. Costs related to successful patent applications are amortized over the lesser of the remaining&#13;useful life of the related technology or the remaining patent life, commencing on the date the patent is issued. Capitalized costs related&#13;to patent applications are expensed in the period in which a determination is made not to pursue such applications.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In accordance with GAAP, if indicators of impairment&#13;exist, we assess the recoverability of the affected long-lived assets, including our capitalized patent costs, by determining whether&#13;the carrying value of such assets can be recovered through undiscounted future operating cash flows. If impairment is indicated, we measure&#13;the amount of such impairment by comparing the carrying value of the asset to the fair value of the asset and we record the impairment&#13;as a reduction in the carrying value of the related asset and a charge to operating results. Estimating the undiscounted future cash flows&#13;associated with long-lived assets requires judgment, and assumptions could differ materially from actual results. There were no patent&#13;impairments during the years ended July 31, 2021 or 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Shipping and Handling Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Shipping and handling costs incurred by us for product&#13;shipments are included in cost of goods sold.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Research and Development Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Research and development costs are expensed as incurred.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Share-Based Compensation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We periodically issue stock options and restricted&#13;stock awards to employees and non-employees in non-capital raising transactions for services and for financing costs. We account for such&#13;grants issued and vesting to employees based on ASC 718, whereby the value of the award is measured on the date of grant and recognized&#13;as compensation expense on the straight-line basis over the vesting period.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We estimate the fair value of share-based payment&#13;awards at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option valuation model. The Black-Scholes option valuation model requires the input&#13;of subjective assumptions, including price volatility of the underlying stock, risk-free interest rate, dividend yield, and expected life&#13;of the option. Share-based compensation expense is based on awards ultimately expected to vest, and therefore is reduced by expected forfeitures.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company determines the fair value of its assets&#13;and liabilities based on the exchange price in U.S. dollars that would be received for an asset or paid to transfer a liability (an exit&#13;price) in the principal or most advantageous market for the asset or liability in an orderly transaction between market participants on&#13;the measurement date. Valuation techniques used to measure fair value maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable&#13;inputs. The Company uses a fair value hierarchy with three levels of inputs, of which the first two are considered observable and the&#13;last unobservable, to measure fair value:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Level 1 &amp;#8212; Quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Level 2 &amp;#8212; Inputs, other than Level 1, that are observable, either directly or indirectly, such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities; quoted prices in markets that are not active; or other inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the assets or liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Level 3 &amp;#8212; Unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are significant to the fair value of the assets or liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The carrying amounts of financial instruments such&#13;as cash, accounts receivable, inventories, accounts payable and accrued liabilities, approximate the related fair values due to the short-term&#13;maturities of these instruments.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Concentrations&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Gross sales&lt;/i&gt;. For the year ended July 31, 2021,&#13;one individual customer accounted for 11% of our net product sales. No other individual customer accounted for 10% or more of our net&#13;product sales. The geographic breakdown of net product sales was as follows: 100% U.S. For the year ended July 31, 2020, three individual&#13;customers accounted for 16%, 13% and 11% of our net product sales. No other individual customer accounted for 10% or more of our net product&#13;sales. The geographic breakdown of net product sales was as follows: 98% U.S. and 2% foreign.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Accounts receivable. &lt;/i&gt;As of July 31, 2021, we&#13;had accounts receivable from three customers that comprised 17%, 15% and 10% of total accounts receivable, respectively. As of July 31,&#13;2020, we had accounts receivable from three customers that comprised 21%, 16% and 11% of total accounts receivable, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Purchases. &lt;/i&gt;For the fiscal year ended July 31,&#13;2021, one vendor accounted for 36% of our purchases. For the fiscal year ended July 31, 2020, one vendor accounted for 54% of our purchases.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Accounts payable.&lt;/i&gt; As of July 31, 2021, one&#13;vendor accounted for 50% of the total trade accounts payable. As of July 31, 2020, one vendor accounted for 66% of the total trade accounts&#13;payable.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We recognize deferred tax assets and liabilities for&#13;temporary differences between the tax basis of assets and liabilities and the amounts at which they are carried in the financial statements&#13;based upon the enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which the differences are expected to reverse. A valuation allowance is established&#13;to reduce deferred tax assets to the amount expected to be realized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Income (Loss) Per Share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Basic earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing&#13;net income (loss) attributable to common stockholders by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted&#13;earnings per share is computed by dividing net income attributable to common stockholders by the sum of the weighted-average number of&#13;common shares outstanding during the period and the weighted-average number of dilutive common share equivalents outstanding during the&#13;period, using the treasury stock method. Dilutive common share equivalents are comprised of in-the-money stock options and restricted&#13;stock units, based on the average stock price for each period using the treasury stock method. Since we incurred a loss for the fiscal&#13;year ended July 31, 2021 the number of shares issuable upon the exercise of stock options, the vesting of restricted stock units, and&#13;the exercise of warrants, none of which are included in the computation of basic net loss per common share, was 10,984,390. For the fiscal&#13;year ended July 31, 2020, the incremental dilutive common share equivalents were 2,402,335.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Segments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We operates in one segment for the manufacture and&#13;distribution of our products. In accordance with the &amp;#8220;Segment Reporting&amp;#8221; Topic of the ASC, our chief operating decision maker&#13;has been identified as the Chief Executive Officer and President, who reviews operating results to make decisions about allocating resources&#13;and assessing performance for the entire Company. Existing guidance, which is based on a management approach to segment reporting, establishes&#13;requirements to report selected segment information quarterly and to report annually entity-wide disclosures about products and services,&#13;major customers, and the countries in which the entity holds material assets and reports revenue. All material operating units qualify&#13;for aggregation under &amp;#8220;Segment Reporting&amp;#8221; due to their similar customer base and similarities in: economic characteristics;&#13;nature of products and services; and procurement, manufacturing and distribution processes. Since the Company operates in one segment,&#13;all financial information required by &amp;#8220;Segment Reporting&amp;#8221; can be found in the accompanying financial statements&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In June 2016, the FASB issued ASU No. 2016-13, Credit&#13;Losses - Measurement of Credit Losses on Financial Instruments (&amp;#8220;ASC 326&amp;#8221;). The standard significantly changes how entities&#13;will measure credit losses for most financial assets, including accounts and notes receivables. The standard will replace today&amp;#8217;s&#13;&amp;#8220;incurred loss&amp;#8221; approach with an &amp;#8220;expected loss&amp;#8221; model , under which companies will recognize allowances based&#13;on expected rather than incurred losses. Entities will apply the standard&amp;#8217;s provisions as a cumulative-effect adjustment to retained&#13;earnings as of the beginning of the first reporting period in which the guidance is effective. As small business filer, the standard will&#13;be effective for us for interim and annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2022. The Company is currently assessing the&#13;impact of adopting this standard on the Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements and related disclosures.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In August 2020, the FASB issued ASU No. 2020-06 (&amp;#8220;ASU&#13;2020-06&amp;#8221;) &amp;#8220;Debt&amp;#8212;Debt with Conversion and Other Options (Subtopic 470-20) and Derivatives and Hedging&amp;#8212;Contracts&#13;in Entity&amp;#8217;s Own Equity (Subtopic 815-40): Accounting for Convertible Instruments and Contracts in an Entity&amp;#8217;s Own Equity.&amp;#8221;&#13;ASU 2020-06 will simplify the accounting for convertible instruments by reducing the number of accounting models for convertible debt&#13;instruments and convertible preferred stock. Limiting the accounting models will result in fewer embedded conversion features being separately&#13;recognized from the host contract as compared with current GAAP. Convertible instruments that continue to be subject to separation models&#13;are (1) those with embedded conversion features that are not clearly and closely related to the host contract, that meet the definition&#13;of a derivative, and that do not qualify for a scope exception from derivative accounting and (2) convertible debt instruments issued&#13;with substantial premiums for which the premiums are recorded as paid-in capital. ASU 2020-06 also amends the guidance for the derivatives&#13;scope exception for contracts in an entity&amp;#8217;s own equity to reduce form-over-substance-based accounting conclusions. ASU 2020-06&#13;will be effective January 1, 2024, for the Company. Early adoption is permitted, but no earlier than January 1, 2021, including interim&#13;periods within that year. Management is currently evaluating the effect of the adoption of ASU 2020-06 on the consolidated financial statements,&#13;but currently does not believe ASU 2020-06 will have a significant impact on the Company&amp;#8217;s accounting.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Recent accounting pronouncements issued by the FASB,&#13;including its Emerging Issues Task Force, the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, and the Securities and Exchange Commission&#13;did not or are not believed by management to have a material impact on the Company&amp;#8217;s present or future consolidated financial statement&#13;presentation or disclosures.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:InventoryPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2020-08-01to2021-07-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Inventories&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or net&#13;realizable value, and net of a valuation allowance for potential excess or obsolete material. Cost is determined using the average cost&#13;method. We regularly review our inventory quantities on hand and record a provision for excess and obsolete inventory based primarily&#13;on our estimated forecast of product demand and our ability to sell the product(s) concerned. Demand for our products can fluctuate significantly.&#13;Factors that could affect demand for our products include unanticipated changes in consumer preferences, general market conditions or&#13;other factors, which may result in cancellations of advance orders or a reduction in the rate of reorders placed by customers. Additionally,&#13;our management&amp;#8217;s estimates of future product demand may be inaccurate, which could result in an understated or overstated provision&#13;required for excess and obsolete inventory. At July 31, 2021, the Company determined that a reserve for inventory obsolescence of $150,000&#13;was required. At July 31, 2020, management determined that a reserve for inventory obsolescence was not required.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:InventoryPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ScheduleOfInventoryCurrentTableTextBlock contextRef="From2020-08-01to2021-07-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Inventories consist of the following:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;     <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-08-01to2021-07-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;4. Commitments and Contingencies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;COVID-19&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The COVID-19 pandemic has led to severe disruptions&#13;in general economic activities, as businesses and federal, state, and local governments take increasingly broad actions to mitigate this&#13;public health crisis. While we have experienced some delays related to final third-party validation of certain of our products and product&#13;rollouts by customers using PURE Control, we have not experienced a material disruption to our business. In addition, we previously benefited&#13;from increased demand from our customers for our PURE Hard Surface product due to a focus on surface disinfecting in response to attempting&#13;to prevent COVID-19 transmission. We subsequently experienced an abatement in such demand and cannot assure you that demand will stabilize.&#13;Additionally, we are beginning to experience supply chain issues with our various plastic packaging configurations and citric acid. Further,&#13;on a go-forward basis, we cannot guarantee the overall economic conditions will not affect our business, as these conditions may significantly&#13;negatively impact all aspects of our business. Our business is dependent on the continued health and productivity of our employees, including&#13;our sales staff and corporate management team.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Additionally, our liquidity could be negatively impacted&#13;if these conditions continue for a significant period of time and we may be required to pursue additional sources of financing to obtain&#13;working capital, maintain appropriate inventory levels, and meet our financial obligations. Currently, capital and credit markets have&#13;been disrupted by the crisis and our ability to obtain any required financing is not guaranteed and largely dependent upon evolving market&#13;conditions and other factors. Depending on the continued impact of the crisis, further actions may be required to improve our cash position&#13;and capital structure.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The extent to which the COVID-19 pandemic ultimately&#13;impacts our business, sales, results of operations and financial condition will depend on future developments, which are highly uncertain&#13;and cannot be predicted, including, but not limited to, the duration and spread of the outbreak, its severity, the actions to contain&#13;the virus or treat its impact, and how quickly and to what extent normal economic and operating conditions resume and, more specifically,&#13;the effect it has on our customers and suppliers. Even after the COVID-19 pandemic has subsided, we may experience significant impacts&#13;to our business as a result of its global economic impact, including any economic downturn or recession that has occurred or may occur&#13;in the future.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Legal&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;From time to time, we could become involved in disputes&#13;and various litigation matters that arise in the normal course of business. Lawsuits against us or our officers or directors by employees,&#13;former employees, stockholders, partners, customers, or others, or actions taken by regulatory authorities, could be very costly and substantially&#13;disrupt our business. Such lawsuits and actions are not uncommon, and we may not be able to resolve such disputes or actions on terms&#13;favorable to us, and there may not be sufficient capital resources available to defend such actions effectively, or at all. As of July&#13;31, 2021, there were no material lawsuits against the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Manufacturing&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Effective June 9, 2019, we entered into a five-year&#13;manufacturing supply agreement with Intercon Chemical Company (ICC) with a three-year renewal term option (the &amp;#8220;Manufacturing Supply&#13;Agreement&amp;#8221;). The agreement consists of manufacturing, packaging, and distribution of PURE&amp;#8217;s SDC-based products and contains&#13;no mandatory purchase commitment levels. The Manufacturing Supply Agreement provides:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;ICC licenses PURE&amp;#8217;s patents and technology know-how for the non-exclusive manufacture of PURE&amp;#8217;s SDC-based products.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;ICC will invest in plant improvements to allow for expanded SDC production.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;ICC&amp;#8217;s R&amp;#38;D team will collaborate on SDC product line development.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Manufacturing Supply Agreement may be terminated&#13;by mutual written consent, or by either party upon the material breach of the terms of the agreement by the other party.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Silver is the primary active ingredient in SDC and&#13;is a readily available commodity. The other active and inactive ingredients in our products are readily available from multiple sources.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SupplementalBalanceSheetDisclosuresTextBlock contextRef="From2020-08-01to2021-07-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;3. Balance Sheet Details&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Inventories consist of the following:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="6" style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;July 31,&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2020&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 72%; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Raw materials&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 11%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;17,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 11%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;17,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Finished goods&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;315,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;366,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SupplementalBalanceSheetDisclosuresTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-08-01to2021-07-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;9. Income Taxes &lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We file federal and state consolidated tax returns&#13;with our subsidiaries. Our income tax provision for the years ended July 31, 2021 and 2020 was $1,650; the minimum state franchise taxes&#13;we pay regardless of income or loss.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;At July 31, 2021, we had federal and state tax net&#13;operating loss carry-forwards of approximately $107.5 million and $62.3 million, respectively. At July 31, 2020, we had federal and state&#13;tax net operating loss carry-forwards of approximately $106.2 million and $61.8 million, respectively. Utilization of the net operating&#13;loss carry-forwards may be subject to a substantial annual limitation due to ownership change limitations that may have occurred or that&#13;could occur in the future, as required by Section 382 of the Internal Revenue Code as well as similar state provisions. These ownership&#13;changes may limit the amount of net operating loss carry-forwards that can be utilized annually to offset future taxable income and tax,&#13;respectively. In general, an ownership change, as defined by Section 382 of the Internal Revenue Code results from a transaction or series&#13;of transactions over a three-year period resulting in an ownership change of more than 50 percentage points of the outstanding stock of&#13;a company by certain stockholders or public groups. Since our formation, we have raised capital through the issuance of capital stock&#13;on several occasions (both before and after our initial public offering in 1996) which, combined with the purchasing stockholders&amp;#8217;&#13;subsequent disposition of those shares, may have resulted in such an ownership change, or could result in an ownership change in the future&#13;upon subsequent disposition. While we do not believe that we have experienced an ownership change, the pertinent tax rules related thereto&#13;are complex and subject to varying interpretations, and thus complete assurance cannot be provided that the taxing authorities would not&#13;take an alternative position.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Our current federal tax loss carry-forwards began&#13;expiring in the year ended July 31, 2020 and, unless previously utilized, all but $3.7 million will completely expire in the year ending&#13;July 31, 2038. The $3.7 million can be carried forward indefinitely. Our state tax loss carry-forwards began to expire in the year ending&#13;July 31, 2029, and will completely expire in the year ending July 31, 2040.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Significant components of our deferred tax assets&#13;are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#8212;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#8212;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Following authoritative guidance, we recognize the&#13;tax benefit from a tax position if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by the taxing authorities,&#13;based on the technical merits of the position.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Our practice is to recognize interest and/or penalties&#13;related to income tax matters in income tax expense; however we have had no accrued interest or penalties at either July 31, 2021 or July&#13;31, 2020. We are subject to income taxes in the United States and in various states, and our historical tax years remain subject to future&#13;examination by the U.S. and state tax authorities. During the years ended July 31, 2021 and 2020, we did not record any activity related&#13;to our unrecognized tax benefits.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company and its subsidiaries are subject to federal&#13;income tax as well as income tax of multiple state jurisdictions. With few exceptions, the Company is no longer subject to income tax&#13;examination by tax authorities in major jurisdictions for tax years prior to 2012. However, to the extent allowed by law, the taxing&#13;authorities may have the right to examine prior periods where net operating losses were generated and carried forward, and make adjustments&#13;up to the amount of the carryforwards. The Company is not currently under examination by the IRS or state taxing authorities.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ScheduleOfEffectiveIncomeTaxRateReconciliationTableTextBlock contextRef="From2020-08-01to2021-07-31">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;A reconciliation of income taxes computed using the&#13;statutory income tax rate, compared to the effective tax rate, is as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2021&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 1.5pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2020&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 72%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Federal tax benefit at the expected statutory rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 11%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;(21&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;)%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 11%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;(21&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;)%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;State income tax, net of federal tax benefit&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;(7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;(7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13; </table>
</div>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).</p></div>

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_Assets">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AssetsCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_CommitmentsAndContingencies">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Represents the caption on the face of the balance sheet to indicate that the entity has entered into (1) purchase or supply arrangements that will require expending a portion of its resources to meet the terms thereof, and (2) is exposed to potential losses or, less frequently, gains, arising from (a) possible claims against a company's resources due to future performance under contract terms, and (b) possible losses or likely gains from uncertainties that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future events that are deemed likely to occur do occur or fail to occur.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_CommonStockValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable common stock (or common stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable common shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/exampleRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 852<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 55<br> -Paragraph 10<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=84165509&amp;loc=d3e56426-112766<br><br>Reference 2: http://fasb.org/us-gaap/role/ref/legacyRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02(29))<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=120391452&amp;loc=d3e13212-122682<br></p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_Liabilities">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all liabilities that are recognized. Liabilities are probable future sacrifices of economic benefits arising from present obligations of an entity to transfer assets or provide services to other entities in the future.</p></div>
